definitions.definition: to (cause to) flow out suddenly and with force, in a fast stream:
examples: Blood was spurting out all over the place.

definitions.definition: to increase or grow very quickly, or to suddenly increase by a particular amount:
examples: Shares of the jewellery store chain spurted $6.

definitions.definition: a sudden and short period of increased activity, effort, or speed:
examples: There was a sudden spurt of activity in the housing market.
